alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:57PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Letcher, east central Perry, central Knott, southeastern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from East McDowell to Halo to Sackett. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wheelwright, Halo, Melvin, Burton, Buckingham, Buckhorn Hollow, Price and Hi Hat around 200 PM EDT. Beaver, Ligon and Speight around 205 PM EDT. Craftsville, Seco, Millstone, Horn, Thornton, Winters, Myra and Mayking around 210 PM EDT. Fleming-Neon, Cromona, Tolliver Town, Haymond, Chip, Neon Junction, Jonancy, Virgie, Lowndes and Whitaker around 215 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Dunham, Potters Fork, Payne Gap, Fishpond Lake, Beefhide, Jenkins, Lookout, Gaskill, Burdine, Rockhouse, Adamson, Elkhorn City, Shelby Gap, Belcher, Cedarville and Ashcamp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
